etymology.description: 幫(幫) (bāng, "help") + 忙(忙) (máng, "busy") = to help; to give assistance
etymology.interpretation: The word 幫忙(幫忙) (bāngmáng, "to help; to give assistance") combines 幫(幫) (bāng, "help") and 忙(忙) (máng, "busy"). The term suggests the act of assisting someone who is busy, thus providing them with relief or support.

examples.chinese: 我正在忙碌(我正在忙碌)，无法帮忙(無法幫忙)。
examples.english: I am busy and cannot help.

examples.chinese: 小明常常帮忙(小明常常幫忙)，他很受大家喜欢(他很受大家喜歡)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎomíng chángcháng bāngmáng, tā hěn shòu dàjiā xǐhuān.
examples.english: Xiaoming often helps and is liked by everyone.
